newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Daewoo chairman sentence suspended.
newsitem.headline: Daewoo chairman sentence suspended.

text.p: A South Korean appeals court on Monday suspended for three years a two-year jail sentence imposed on the founding chairman of Daewoo Group, Kim Woo-choong, on bribery charges, state-run television reported.
Kim was convicted of the charges in August during a series of trials linked to proceedings against disgraced presidents Chun Doo Hwan and his successor Roh Tae-woo.
Earlier on Monday, Chun's death sentence was commuted to life imprisonment and Roh's 22-1/2 year jail term was cut to 17 years.

Kim was among five businessmen whose jail terms were suspended or who were acquitted in the Seoul High Court's afternoon session. The chairman of Daewoo Corp., a unit of Kim's Daewoo group, one of South Korea's top three business conglomerates, was one of two tycoons cleared.
Also acquitted was the chairman of the Hanbo Group. Jail terms imposed on the chairmen of the Dong-Ah and Jinro groups were also suspended.
